title: SoC THEATRE 140-2-24 Theatre in Context

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will study practices of theatre history and performance critique by mapping reception of the theatrical event as a global phenomenon for the Western World. As writers of theatre history and performance critique, how do we construct our audiences? Over the course of the quarter we will address canonical moments in the formation of a global theatre history, asking how contemporary concepts of audience formation influence discourses on the theatrical event. Culminating in a student-designed research project, this course mixes lectures, discussion, and in-class writings to explore methods for theatre history performance critique.
